title: [Self-Directed] Mobile-Based Language-Linguistic Intelligence Program for Integrated Improvement of Social and Language Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language proficiency, digital device utilization skills, foundational understanding of social phenomena, open attitude toward diverse cultures, and basic awareness of citizens' rights and responsibilities
context.additional_context: Smartphone-centric learning environment with 15–20-minute modules, 3–5 weekly mobile platform logins. Includes cultural comparison analysis, civic engagement activities, and project-based learning for local community problem-solving. Provides collaborative opportunities to build social relationships among learners.

learning_goals: Over four weeks, learners must improve reading/writing/speaking scores and social communication skills by ≥30% through language-cognitive enhancement activities and strengthen civic engagement competencies considering cultural contexts.
Learners must independently perform and certify ≥3 weekly language reasoning and cultural context analysis activities via a mobile platform and explore connections with social institutions.

Learners must analyze a ≥500-word academic text or social phenomenon using linguistic thinking tools (mind maps, keyword linking), derive ≥3 key concepts, structure them visually (digital or hand-drawn) to meet ≥2 of 3 rubric criteria (clarity, logic, visual impact), and include practical proposals for local community problem-solving.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
